description:
Brucella ciceri is a species of bacteria that belongs to the genus Brucella. Brucella is a genus of Gram-negative, facultatively intracellular coccobacilli bacteria that are known to cause brucellosis, a zoonotic disease that can infect various animal species and humans.

Brucella ciceri is specifically associated with the legume plant Cicer arietinum, commonly known as chickpea or garbanzo bean. It is believed to be a plant-associated Brucella species that can potentially infect and colonize the root nodules of chickpea plants.

The genome of Brucella ciceri has been sequenced, and it has been found to possess genetic similarities with other Brucella species, suggesting a shared evolutionary history. However, Brucella ciceri is considered a distinct species due to its unique host preference and adaptations to the chickpea plant environment.

Further research is ongoing to understand the ecological role, pathogenicity, and potential impact of Brucella ciceri on chickpea cultivation and production. Understanding the biology and interactions of this species can contribute to the overall knowledge of the Brucella genus and its diversity.
